alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:06PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Lunenburg County through 345 PM EDT... At 305 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rehoboth, or 8 miles southwest of Victoria, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and locally heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Victoria, Lunenburg, Rehoboth, Kells Corner, Gary, Wilburn, Loves Mill, Arvins Store, Nutbush, Plantersville, Blevins Corner, Pleasant Grove and Oral Oaks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
